DOC.brief_title: Management Labor Patients With Previous Cesarian Section
DOC.criteria: Diagnosed pregnant PROM > 34 week . Rupture membranes determine clinically confirm positive Nitrazine test . Ruptured membrane occur last 24 hour prior inclusion study . Found unripe cervix speculum examination . Singleton pregnancy vertex presentation well apply cervix absence significant regular uterine contraction ( 35/10 Min ) Previous cesarian section . Willingness comply protocol duration study . Have sign inform consent . Patients follow condition : Any contraindication vaginal delivery ( i.e . placenta previa , non vertex presentation ) . Regular uterine contraction ( 35/10 min ) . Diagnosis rupture membrane make 24 hour prior study inclusion . Evidence chorioamnionitis ( T 37.6 celsious Degree uterine tenderness maternal fetal tachycardia purulent discharge WBC > /=20,000 ) Suspected placental abruption presence significant hemorrhage . Nonreassuring fetal status ( determine fetal heart rate monitoring and/or biophysical profile ) necessitate immediate intervention .
